Israel's reign of terror over the West Bank
subhead: Deadly shootings by the army, beatings by settlers, devastating raids, arbitrary arrests, torture in prison: The level of violence inflicted on Palestinians living in the territory has never been so high since the Israeli occupation began in 1967.

subhead: The French first lady's entourage said her comments were only intended to criticize the 'radical methods' of the activists. Several French actresses took to social media to condemn her words.

title: French PM Lecornu's budget bet starts to pay off
subhead: The hung Assemblée Nationale passed a budget bill for the social security system on Tuesday. So far, Sébastien Lecornu's strategy of compromise has been effective, if costly.

title: Sophie Kinsella, British 'Shopaholic' author, dies aged 55
subhead: Madeleine Sophie Wickham, who wrote under the pen name Sophie Kinsella, revealed last year that she was receiving chemotherapy and radiotherapy for glioblastoma, an aggressive form of brain cancer.

title: 'By appeasing Russia and accommodating China, the Trump administration is carving up the world into spheres of influence'
subhead: Since the release of the US National Security Strategy on December 5, the increasingly harsh tone of the transatlantic relationship has drawn attention, even though this power struggle was not among Donald Trump's main priorities, writes Le Monde columnist Gilles Paris.

The incomplete transformation of Syria's Ahmed al-Sharaa, Islamist rebel turned president
subhead: 'Syria after Assad' (1/4). The man who toppled Syria's Baathist regime has succeeded in breaking the country's international isolation. Yet the former jihadist, who governs with a handful of loyal followers, has struggled to defuse the sectarian and ethnic tensions left by the civil war.

title: Trapped by old treaties with Russia, Europeans face threat of heavy financial penalties
subhead: A new report warns of the significant risk facing the European Union due to arbitration proceedings launched by Russian oligarchs and companies targeted by sanctions.

title: President Nicusor Dan: 'In Romania, we do not have a real policy to defend against disinformation'
subhead: Romania borders Ukraine and is at the front line against Russian interference, which led to the cancellation of the presidential election a year ago. In an interview with Le Monde, President Nicusor Dan, elected in May, revisits the matter and discusses the differences between Europe and the US regarding the war in Ukraine.
